articles.summary: Colorado Gov. Jared Polis called a special legislative session for August 21st to discuss the state's Artificial Intelligence Act. The law is scheduled to take effect next February. It requires companies to conduct bias risk assessments, notify users when AI is involved in consequential decisions and provide an appeals process for those adversely affected. Tech companies like Amazon, Google and Salesforce oppose the law, while Microsoft and IBM support it.

articles.title: GSA partners with OpenAI to give federal agencies access to ChatGPT for $1 annually

articles.summary: The General Services Administration announced a partnership with OpenAI on Wednesday. articles.title: Project Ire: Microsoft Tests AI That Autonomously Detects Malware
articles.author: Aminu Abdullahi
articles.summary: Project Ire is an autonomous AI agent designed to reverse engineer software and determine whether it is malicious without any human guidance or prior knowledge of the file's origin. The AI uses a combination of decompilers, memory analysis sandboxes, control flow reconstruction tools, and advanced language models to dissect and understand software code. In tests using a public dataset of Windows drivers, the system achieved high accuracy and a relatively strong decision rate. It correctly identified almost 9 out of 10 malicious files, but it only detected about 26% of all actual malware.

articles.title: OpenAI teases GPT-5 launch event this Thursday
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI is teasing a big announcement on Thursday at 10 AM PT. The company is expected to release its long-awaited GPT-5 AI model. Microsoft has been preparing servers for the new model. OpenAI also announced GPTOSS on Tuesday.

articles.title: OpenAI teases GPT-5 launch event this Thursday
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI is teasing a big announcement on Thursday at 10 AM PT. The company is expected to release its long-awaited GPT-5 AI model. On Sunday, CEO Sam Altman posted a screenshot with 'ChatGPT 5' in the top-left corner, and the company's head of applied research posted on Monday that he's 'excited to see how the public receives GPT 5!'

articles.title: Precise Code Requests: Vibe Coding & Software Engineers
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: By 2028, nearly 80% of routine coding tasks will be automated, according to Forrester report. The future of software engineering is about designing systems, managing complexity, and orchestrating the AI tools that handle the grunt work. AI is becoming a collaborative partner in the software development lifecycle. It can assist with code reviews, identify potential vulnerabilities, and even generate unit tests.

articles.title: ChatGPT is sharing dangerous information with teens, study shows
articles.author: Listen to
articles.summary: ChatGPT will tell 13-year-olds how to get drunk and high, instruct them on how to conceal eating disorders and even compose a suicide letter to their parents if asked, according to new research from watchdog group Center for Countering Digital Hate. About 800 million people are using ChatGPT.

articles.title: The role of AI in shaping auto insurance
articles.author: Tito Bucheli
articles.summary: The auto insurance industry is going through a major transformation. Artificial intelligence is reshaping how insurers operate and how drivers manage their coverage. It affects everything from faster claims processing to more accurate pricing and it's changing the way insurers operate as well as the way drivers manage insurance coverage.

articles.title: Integral Ad Science Receives Industry's First Ethical AI Certification from Alliance for Audited Media (SIIA - Software & Information Industry Association)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Integral Ad Science has received the first Ethical AI certification from Alliance for Audited Media August 6, 2025. It is a global media measurement and optimization platform that helps advertisers and audiences understand how artificial intelligence is being used in the media industry. It's the first of its kind.

articles.title: Bharatgen AI To Support All 22 Scheduled Indian Languages By June 2026: Minister
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: The government's BharatGen AI initiative will cover all 22 scheduled Indian languages by June 2026, the Parliament was informed on Wednesday. The move is part of the government's "BharatGen" initiative to cover all the Indian languages.

articles.title: Nvidia warns that any GPU 'kill switch' or 'backdoor' into its AI chips would 'fracture trust in US technology'
articles.summary: Nvidia is against AI chip "kill switches" and backdoors. Chinese officials expressed concern to Nivida about potential "backdoor security risks" in its H20 chips. Nvidia's chips are used by OpenAI, Meta and other major companies to train and operate advanced AI language models.

articles.title: Elastic Announces Elastic AI SOC Engine for Exposing Complex, Hidden Threats
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Elastic announced the launch of Elastic AI SOC Engine (EASE), a new serverless, easy-to-deploy security package. EASE brings AI-driven context-aware detection and triage into existing SIEM and EDR tools without the need for migration or replacement.

articles.title: AWS Integrates OpenAI Models, Expanding AI Services Availability
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has announced the integration of OpenAI's GPT-4 and other AI models directly through its cloud platform. The integration streamlines AI development and deployment for businesses of all sizes. The competition between AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud in the AI space will continue to drive innovation.

articles.title: Airbnb guest accused of causing $16K in property damage claims host ‘used AI to create fake photos'
articles.author: Brooke Steinberg
articles.summary: Airbnb has apologized to a woman after her host used artificial intelligence to claim she had caused thousands of dollars worth of damage to her apartment in Manhattan. The London-based woman booked a one-bedroom apartment for a two-and-a-half month stay. She decided to leave the apartment early because she felt unsafe in the area. The host claimed that she caused $16,000 (£12,000) in damages. The guest found out that the host used AI to submit pictures of a seemingly cracked coffee table and stained a mattress with urine and damaged a robot vacuum cleaner, a sofa, a microwave, a TV and an air conditioner. Airbnb apologized to the woman and

articles.title: OpenAI to provide ChatGPT to federal agencies for $1, and Seattle's Slalom will assist worker training
articles.author: Kurt Schlosser
articles.summary: OpenAI is providing U.S. federal government agencies access to ChatGPT Enterprise for $1 per agency for the next year. Seattle-based business and technology consulting firm Slalom will help facilitate the initiative. It will lead AI coaching and workshops, teach teams how to best leverage ChatG PT, and support them with playbooks, training sessions, and hackathons.

articles.title: Some AI tools don't understand biology yet
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: Biology is one of the areas in which AI and machine learning approaches have seen some spectacular successes, such as designing enzymes to digest plastics and proteins to block snake venom. However, in an era of endless AI hype, it is still a relatively new field.

articles.title: Google swears it isn't destroying the web with AI search
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Google's AI search engine is not hurting website traffic, according to Liz Reid, head of Google Search. Pew Research found that people are less likely to click on links when presented with an AI Overview or the AI-generated summary that appears at the top of the search results page.

articles.title: AI Search Is Killing the Click: Web Traffic Faces Sharp Decline
articles.author: Ajaxurl
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming how people search online. Google, ChatGPT and Perplexity's AI-driven search results allow users to access information at a glance, reducing the need to click through to traditional news, informational, and e-commerce websites. Wikipedia saw its daily visitors decline from 165 million in 2022 to 128 million in March 2025, a 23% drop. News-related searches via chatGPT rose 212% in 2025 compared to 2024. OpenAI plans to launch its own web browser to compete with Google Chrome.

articles.title: North Port police assist FBI in AI-created child porn arrest
articles.author: Jim De La
articles.summary: Daniel Weatherly, 42, of Brownwood, Texas, has been sentenced to two years in federal prison for possessing AI-created images of a minor engaging in sexually explicit conduct. He will also serve three years of supervised release and have no contact with minors following his prison sentence. Weatherly's girlfriend found the images on his phone and called police.

articles.title: Wikipedia goes to war against AI slop articles with new deletion policy
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: As the web fills up with junk text written by robots, it's no surprise that AI-generated slop is also making its way into ebooks, YouTube, and even Wikipedia. Wikipedia's open access is its main drawback.   "Here is your Wikipedia article on…"

articles.title: Microsoft's agentic HTML can leak passwords and AI keys, researcher finds
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: A researcher has discovered a vulnerability in Microsoft's NLWeb technology that allows AI agents to interact with websites on your behalf. It's a path traversal bug that lets any remote user read sensitive files like system configurations and cloud credentials via a malformed URL. Microsoft's Security Response Center pushed a patch to GitHub repository in June, confirming the problem was fixed.

articles.title: How to reason with OpenAI's spiralling valuation
articles.author: Financial Times
articles.summary: Just a few days ago, OpenAI was worth $300bn, now it might be worth $500bn. Sam Altman's company might be the most valuable company in the world, according to some estimates. There is an error retrieving data from the portfolio.

articles.title: OpenAI targets $500 billion in employee share sale
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: OpenAI is in the early stages of a share sale. Existing investors, including Thrive Capital, are in discussions to participate. The company recently announced its most recent $8.3 billion tranche tied to the previous $40 billion funding round. OpenAI's annual recurring revenue is projected to top $20 billion by year-end.

articles.title: Google launches $1 billion education program to bring AI training and tools to U.S. colleges
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: Google announced a three-year, $1 billion commitment on Wednesday to provide AI training and tools to U.S. colleges and nonprofits. More than 100 universities are already on board, including major public systems like Texas A&M and the University of North Carolina. Participating schools will get access to cloud computing credits for AI-related coursework and research, and paid AI tools such as an advanced version of Google's Gemini chatbot.

articles.title: ChatGPT maker quietly shakes the AI landscape and Elon Musk's xAI
articles.author: Moz Farooque
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker is reportedly in early talks for a secondary share sale. ChatGPT serves north of 700 million weekly active users as of August, up from 400 million earlier this year. OpenAI's rumored $500 billion valuation just flipped the script on the AI investment game.

articles.title: The Money OpenAI Is Making by Betraying Its Nonprofit Roots Is Obscene
articles.summary: OpenAI was founded as a nonprofit research institute dedicated to realizing an "artificial general intelligence" that benefits all of humanity. Now the company has changed its name to a profit-maximizing corporation. It is in talks about a potential secondary stock sale that would value it at half a trillion dollars. It recently secured a $300 billion funding deal.

articles.title: OpenAI offers federal agencies use of ChatGPT for $1 for one year
articles.author: Lisa Hornung
articles.summary: OpenAI announced it will offer its ChatGPT Enterprise product to the agencies in the federal executive branch for $1 per agency for the next year. The company has been working to get closer to lawmakers and regulators in recent months. OpenAI announced a $40 billion funding round in March at a $300 billion valuation, the largest amount ever raised by a private tech company.

articles.title: AI as a study tool
articles.author: Ayana Archie
articles.summary: Last week, OpenAI launched "study mode" in its chatbot aimed directly at the student market. Google announced a suite of study-oriented tools the same day. Chegg sells textbooks and offers a slate of digital services, such as generating flash cards and practice questions. Macmillan Learning sells textbooks, e-books and quizzes, and it offers quizzes and study guides.

articles.title: Google wants you to be a citizen data scientist
articles.author: Victor Dey
articles.summary: Google Cloud is investing heavily in AI agents to close the gap between data insights and real-world decisions. The company envisions a future where AI agents are deeply embedded within enterprise systems, assisting with data analysis while leaving strategic decision-making to people. It's a shift that could redefine data jobs across industries.

articles.title: AI in Education: Transforming How We Learn & Teach
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Nearly 40% of jobs could be impacted by AI within the next three years, according to McKinsey report. Children are growing up in a world shaped by technology. They expect technology to understand them, personalize experiences, and simply work for them. The future is uncertain, but the skills and mindset needed to thrive will be different from those of previous generations.

articles.title: Why did Meta invest in Scale AI – and how will it change the AI ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: What's next for AI training and evaluation after the Scale/Meta deal is not yet clear.    - it's not clear yet what's the next step for AI in this field.  It's possible that it will become more focused on machine learning.

articles.title: OpenAI readies for GPT-5 release as it launches 2 'open' models
articles.author: Daily Sabah
articles.summary: OpenAI is likely just days away from the launch of GPT-5, the latest installment of the artificial intelligence technology that powered the ChatGPT juggernaut in 2022 and users will be able to use it soon. It's the latest version of the GPT technology.

articles.title: OpenAI offers ChatGPT to federal agencies for $1 for the next year
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: OpenAI will offer ChatGPT to federal agencies for $1 a year as part of a new partnership with the General Services Administration. The agency added OpenAI's AI model to its government purchasing system, alongside Google's Gemini and Anthropic's Claude. Anthropic is also planning to make its AI models available to the government for as little as $1.

articles.title: The New Frontier Of The IdeaFactory
articles.author: George Webb
articles.summary: AlphaFold, Google's AI program, won the Nobel Prize last year. It predicts how proteins fold correctly for normal development and how they misfold to create disease. Eric Schmidt took the project from Sun Microsystems to Google and created DeepMind to work on the complex problem.

articles.title: British MP Unveils AI Clone to Handle Constituents, Faces Immediate Backlash for ‘Lazy' Representation
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.summary: Labour MP for Leeds South West and Morley, Mark Sewards, launched an AI chatbot on Tuesday. The chatbot mimics Sewards's voice and Yorkshire accent. It is programmed to assist with information and facilitate communication, but not to replace direct engagement. It has some limitations, such as not knowing the most important issues.

articles.title: This tech CEO is trying to stop AI killing the internet. Why is everyone so mad at him?
articles.author: Alistair Barr
articles.summary: The rise of AI-powered answer engines threatens the web's business model. Google crawls 18 web pages for every 1 user it sends to a site, up from 2 to 1 a decade ago. Big Tech and AI companies have an incentive to downplay the value of data in models, chatbots, and related products. Cloudflare's CEO Matthew Prince is trying to address this growing crisis.

articles.title: Ways Marketers Can Succeed In The New AI-First World
articles.author: Megan Poinski
articles.summary: According to a report, 91% of marketers are producing more content in 2025 than in any year prior. Three-quarters of U.S. marketers regularly use AI, 67% are using it for content creation, and half have AI tools built into their tech stack. Donald Trump liked a controversial American Eagle denim ad featuring actor Sydney Sweeney. Disney reached a deal with the NFL to take a 10% stake in the network. ESPN will stream NFL games on its network and extend the broadcast rights to broadcast the draft.

articles.title: These Democrats Think the Party Needs AI to Win Elections
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: The National Democratic Training Committee has made the first official playbook for the use of AI by Democratic campaigns ahead of the midterms. It's called "The First Practical Guide to AI for Democratic Campaigns". It's available on the DNC website here.

articles.title: New research shows the 10 jobs most at risk of being replaced by AI—and 10 jobs that are safe
articles.author: Jennifer Mattson
articles.summary: New research from Microsoft shows which jobs are most likely to be impacted by artificial intelligence. The most common work activities people used AI for involved gathering information and writing. The top 10 occupations with highest AI applicability score are Interpreters and Translators, Historians, Passengers Attendants, Sales Representatives of Services, Writers and Authors, CNC Tool Programmers, Phone Operators, Ticket Agents, Travel Clerks, Broadcast Announcers and Radio DJs, Phlebotomists, Nursing Assistants, Hazardous Materials Removal Workers, Plasterers, Embalmers and System Operators.

articles.title: RedSeal Launches AI-Enabled RedSeal One Platform to Power Proactive Exposure Management Across Hybrid Environments
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: RedSeal One is an AI-enabled platform helping organizations reduce risk, streamline operations and strengthen resilience across hybrid environments. RedSeal is based in Menlo Park, California, and is available on Amazon's App Store.    for Android and iOS.

articles.title: Tech Expert to Newsmax: 'Everybody' is Using AI in the Marketplace
articles.author: Jim Mishler
articles.summary: Retired FBI agent Scott Augenbaum believes the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in the marketplace is widespread. Delta Airlines recently disclosed it was using AI to determine pricing for some of its fares. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said it was concerning, especially if AI was being used to set individualized fare pricing.

articles.title: Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC) Ends 6-Day Losses on Bullish Analyst Ratings
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Lattice Semiconductor Corp. (NASDAQ:LSCC) is one of the best-performing stocks on Tuesday. KeyBanc gave the company an 'overweight' rating with a price target of $70. Stifel maintained a 'buy' recommendation with a target price of $60 for the company.

articles.title: Oklo (OKLO) Jumps 10% as NASA Planning Nuclear Reactor on Moon
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO) grew its share prices by 10.05 percent on Tuesday to close at $84.09 each as investors gobbled up shares following the National Aeronautics and Space Administration's plans to build a nuclear reactor on the moon. Oklo is set to announce the results of its financial and operating highlights for the second quarter and the first half of the year after market close on Monday, August 11.

articles.title: Inspire Medical (INSP) Takes 32% Nosedive on Dismal Earnings, Outlook
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Inspire Medical Systems, Inc. (NYSE:INSP) is one of the worst-performing stocks on Tuesday. The company posted a $3.59 million net loss in the second quarter of the year, reversing a $9.8 million net income in the same period last year. Revenues jumped by 10.7 percent to $217 million from $195.88 million. For full-year 2025, the company expects revenues to settle between $900 million and $910 million.

articles.title: Alight Inc. (ALIT) Nosedives 18% as Earnings Disappoint
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Alight Inc. (NYSE:ALIT) declined by 18.32 percent on Tuesday to end at $4.19 apiece. The company reported a disappointing earnings performance in the second quarter of the year. For the first half, attributable net loss widened by 1,106 percent to $1.098 billion from $91 million in the same period last year.

articles.title: Google Commits $1B for AI Training at US Universities
articles.author: Kenrick Cai
articles.summary: Alphabet's Google announced a three-year, $1 billion commitment to provide artificial intelligence training and tools to U.S. higher education institutions and nonprofits. More than 100 universities have signed on to the initiative, including some of the nation's largest public university systems such as Texas A&M and the University of North Carolina. Google hopes to expand the program to every accredited nonprofit college in the U.,S. and is discussing similar plans in other countries.

articles.title: Google commits $1 billion for AI training at US universities
articles.author: Kenrick Cai
articles.summary: Google announced a three-year, $1 billion commitment to provide artificial intelligence training and tools to U.S. higher education institutions and nonprofits. More than 100 universities have signed on to the initiative, including some of the nation's largest public university systems such as Texas A&M and the University of North Carolina. Google hopes to expand the program to every accredited nonprofit college in the U.,S. and is discussing similar plans in other countries.

articles.title: 🔒 At inaugural Hartford HealthCare AI summit, the key to the future is trust
articles.author: David Krechevsky
articles.summary: Hartford HealthCare's first AI summit was held both in person and virtually Tuesday evening. The four-hour event attracted more than 300 people, including more than 200 watching online. It featured five presentations and four panel discussions on AI topics including venture capital investments, the speed and safety of personalized care, the financial, legal and security risks, and the impact on patients.

articles.title: This is how malicious hackers could exploit Gemini AI to control a smart home.
articles.author: Richard Lawler
articles.summary: Hackers could exploit Gemini AI to control a smart home. Google was informed of the vulnerabilities they found in February and said it has already introduced 'multiple fixes.' Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed and to receive email updates.

articles.title: Google Takes Aim At ChatGPT Study Mode With Major Gemini Updates
articles.author: Dan Fitzpatrick
articles.summary: Today Google released Gemini, a free AI education tool for college students. It's a response to OpenAI's "Study Mode" for ChatGPT, a feature designed to position its chatbot as the ultimate academic assistant. Google also invested $1 billion in AI education.

articles.title: Google's new tool wants to do your coding for you, and it's out of beta now
articles.author: Mahnoor Faisal
articles.summary: Google's AI-powered personal assistant, NotebookLM, is one of the best productivity tools out there. Google's first AI coding agent, Jules, has been in public beta since May. Jules is finally available for everyone today. It's powered by Gemini 2.5, the same model that powers the rest of Google's AI tools. It has a refreshed user-friendly interface and new structured tiers with higher limits for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers.

articles.title: Tuskira Upgrades Agentic AI for Security Operations
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Tuskira announced significant upgrades to its Agentic AI Workforce. The platform's reach expands across investigation, simulation, and autonomous mitigation. The enhanced platform brings control-level response to the frontlines of threat operations in simulating live threats and validating business impact.

articles.title: Philadelphia is using AI-driven cameras to keep bus lanes clear. Transparency can help build trust in the system
articles.author: Murugan Anandarajan
articles.summary: The Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority piloted a new AI-powered ticketing system in Philadelphia in 2023. In 70 days, the cameras flagged over 36,000 cars blocking bus lanes. It comes as SEPTA faces a $213 million budget shortfall, with imminent service cuts and fare hikes.

articles.title: Google's AI coding agent Jules is now out of beta
articles.author: Jagmeet Singh
articles.summary: Jules is an agent-based coding tool that integrates with GitHub and clones codebases into Google Cloud virtual machines. It uses AI to fix or update code while developers focus on other tasks. Google took Jules out of beta two months after its public preview debut in May. Jules has 2.28 million visits worldwide, 45% of them from mobile devices.

articles.title: Microsoft is bringing its Xbox Copilot to the Windows Game Bar
articles.author: Tom Warren
articles.summary: Microsoft started testing its Xbox Copilot chatbot on iOS and Android earlier this year. Now it's bringing the chatbot to the Game Bar feature on Windows 11. Xbox Insiders can start testing a preview of the integration today. The early preview is only available in English and limited to the US, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Singapore.

articles.title: Character.AI launches social feed to let users interact, create, and share with AI personas
articles.author: Listen to
articles.summary: Character.AI has added an interactive feed to its mobile apps on Monday. Users interact with user-generated characters instead of passively scrolling. They can rewrite narratives, insert themselves into storylines, or shift characters from scenes to streams. Subscribers with access to Character.AI's new video generation feature, Avatar FX, can also post short AI-generated videos of any character on the platform.

articles.title: Exclusive: Google Gemini adds AI tutoring, heating up the fight for student users
articles.author: Just in
articles.summary: Google has introduced Guided Learning within its Gemini chatbot. The new feature is part of the AI industry's response to growing concerns that chatbots like ChatGPT may undermine education by bypassing the learning process with quick answers. Google's vision is to have an AI tutor for every student and a TA for every teacher.

articles.title: Google's AI coding agent Jules is now out of beta
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Jules is an agent-based coding tool that integrates with GitHub and clones codebases into Google Cloud virtual machines using AI. Google launched Jules out of beta on Wednesday. Jules' paid tiers are priced at $19.99 and $124.99 a month.

articles.title: Opinion: Utah's AI innovation ecosystem can serve as a model for implementing America's AI Action Plan
articles.author: Manish Parashar
articles.summary: America's AI Action Plan outlines three pillars aimed at securing U.S. leadership in the age of AI. Utah's AI innovation ecosystem can serve as a model for implementing the plan. University of Utah's One-U Responsible Artificial Intelligence Initiative brings together transdisciplinary research expertise, statewide advanced cyberinfrastructure, education and workforce development, partnerships, and community engagement.

articles.title: A stranger fixed my Nespresso machine when I most needed it. Decades later, I still think of her.
articles.summary: Abbi Perets bought a Nespresso coffee machine in 2013. Her 10-year-old son with leukaemia was diagnosed with cancer. She took it to the service center on Monday morning. A young woman in her 20s helped her. She fixed the coffee machine for free.

articles.title: The ‘write' way to use AI in college essays
articles.author: Brian Safdari
articles.summary: According to a recent survey, 20% of college applicants used AI to write their essays. The Common App published its 2025-26 essay prompts, which remained the same from 2024-25, in February. It's important to use AI intelligently and ethically when writing an essay.

articles.title: WhatsApp deletes 6.8M scam accounts globally
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: WhatsApp has taken down 6.8 million scam-linked accounts linked to criminal scam centers in Cambodia as part of its efforts to crack down on scams. Meta, which owns Facebook and Instagram, is rolling out new tools on WhatsApp to help people spot scams.

articles.title: Gov. Jared Polis imposes hiring freeze, as Colorado lawmakers prepare to cut $1B from budget
articles.author: Marianne Goodland
articles.summary: Gov. Jared Polis will convene the legislature on Aug. 21 to enact cuts to the state budget amid a $1 billion deficit. The governor confirmed that, in addition to spending reductions, the special session will deal with AI regulation. Lawmakers approved new AI regulations last year.

articles.title: Bloodied pig's head mailed to Las Vegas man after AI real estate deal
articles.author: James Schaeffer
articles.summary: Blake Owens, CEO of Agrippa, received a pig's head in a box on Friday. He suspects it was sent in response to a news story about artificial intelligence. The person who sent the delivery may be worried about losing their job to AI, according to Owens.

articles.title: Absolute Security Unveils GenAI Assistant and Automation Innovations to Spot and Remediate Endpoint Risk in Near Real Time
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Absolute Security announced new innovations available on the Absolute Resilience Platform. An advanced GenAI assistant enables natural-language queries that instantly answer vital questions about the security and compliance status of endpoint devices. Enhanced application control helps ensure critical endpoint and network security defenses are present across every device. Customizable dashboards deliver enhanced insights that support your organization's unique IT and security environment.

articles.title: Disney's Secret Experiments With AI Have Reportedly Been a Comical Disaster
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Behind the scenes, Disney has been struggling to deploy AI. Disney is accused of copyright infringement and plagiarism in the movies and TV shows it produces.  It's a myth that workers in the movie and TV industries are set to be trampled by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: AI Contractors at Meta Could See Users' Personal Data, Including Selfies
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: To fine-tune its AI models, Meta hires outside contractors to read conversations between users and its chatbot. Contractors claim to have seen user's personal information in Meta AI chats. Meta claims to have strict controls on what information its employees and contractors can see.

articles.title: OpenAI offers ChatGPT for $1 a year to U.S. government workers
articles.author: Chloe Jad
articles.summary: OpenAI is providing access to its ChatGPT chatbot to U.S. federal agencies at a nominal cost of $1 a year. General Services Administration approved OpenAI, Google and Anthropic as vendors in its new marketplace allowing federal agencies to buy AI software at scale. The GSA has used its buying power before to negotiate discounts with software providers like Adobe Inc. and Salesforce Inc. but the $1-a-year pricing from OpenAI is the deepest yet.

articles.title: China Turns to A.I. in Information Warfare
articles.summary: GoLaxy, a Chinese company, is using artificial intelligence to influence public opinion on behalf of the Chinese government, according to the documents obtained by Vanderbilt University researchers. GoLaxy has influence campaigns in Taiwan, Hong Kong and inside China and collected data on members of Congress and influential Americans. It is not clear from the documents how effective its campaigns have been or whether its technology can do all it promises.

articles.title: My Chemical Romance to deliver an 'apex' emo moment at MetLife Stadium
articles.author: app
articles.summary: Engineers at Columbia University created Emo, a robot that can mimic facial expressions using AI technology. Emo is short for emotional rock and grew out of the punk rock movement. It is based on "Where Are Your Boys Tonight: The Oral History of Emo's Mainstream Explosion 1999-2008".

articles.title: China Turns to A.I. in Information Warfare
articles.author: Julian E. Barnes
articles.summary: Chinese government is using companies with expertise in artificial intelligence to monitor and manipulate public opinion. One company has undertaken influence campaigns in Hong Kong and Taiwan, and collected data on members of Congress and other influential Americans. American spy agencies have monitored its activity for signs that it might try to influence American elections or political debates.

articles.title: AI imaging may enable doctors to treat brain cancer faster, create better patient outcomes
articles.author: Rebecca Barnabi
articles.summary: UVA researcher Dr. Bijoy Kundu and colleagues are developing an AI imaging approach to distinguish between tumor progression and brain changes caused by tumor treatment. In 26 glioblastoma patients immediately after treatment, the artificial intelligence made the correct distinction 74 percent of the time. Doctors have to wait three to four months after treatment to assess the progression of the tumor.

articles.title: Tavily raises $25M to connect AI agents to the web
articles.author: Marina Temkin
articles.summary: Insight Partners led a $20 million Series A in Tavily, a startup that connects AI agents to the web in a way that's compliant with company-specific policies. Tavily was founded last year by data scientist Rotem Weiss. It provides a suite of tools to companies like Groq, Cohere, MongoDB and Writer.

articles.title: Five ways that AI is learning to improve itself
articles.author: Grace Huckins
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg wants to create smarter-than-human AI. Meta Superintelligence Labs will be focused on building self-improving AI. AI is already contributing to its own development and is set to take more of a role in the years to come. Here are five ways that AI is making itself better.

articles.title: Some questions about that global AI race
articles.author: AARON MAK
articles.summary: The conventional wisdom is that the U.S. has an edge on China in artificial intelligence. Trump's new AI policy is built around keeping that edge. It's hard to argue that America isn't currently leading the AI race. The San Francisco Bay Area is unquestionably the global AI talent and business capital. China has proved in recent months that it's within striking distance of American AI models.

articles.title: Deepmind's genie 3 unveils dystopian path to AI domination, cloaked in interactive virtual playgrounds
articles.author: The Eastern Herald
articles.summary: artificial general intelligence (AGI) in the West's dangerous obsession with AGI in the modern world, says Dr. Richard Stallman.   for AI in the future.  for the future, he adds Dr. Rick Stallman  for AGI.

articles.title: AI is gutting workforces—and an ex-Google exec says CEOs are too busy ‘celebrating' their efficiency gains to see they're next
articles.author: Emma Burleigh
articles.summary: Mo Gawdat is the former chief business officer for Google X. He believes AI will be better at everything than humans and create new jobs for the best in their fields. However, Gawdat warns that the best software developers will stay for a while and the best CEOs will be replaced by AI. For humans to thrive, immoral world leaders need to be replaced with AI.

articles.title: AI Marketing Platform ASK BOSCO Secures £4.1M to Revolutionise Digital Ad Spend Strategy
articles.author: Chris Sinclair

articles.title: Hackers Hijacked Google's Gemini AI With a Poisoned Calendar Invite to Take Over a Smart Home
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: For the first time ever, security researchers have shown how AI can be hacked to create real world havoc, allowing them to turn off lights, open smart shutters, and more. The research was carried out by security researchers at the University of California, San Francisco.

articles.title: AI Platform Market $94.30 billion by 2030
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The global AI Platform Market size is projected to reach USD 94.30 billion by 2030 from USD 18.22 billion in 2025 at a CAGR of 38.9% during the forecast period. The market is expected to reach $94.30billion by 2030.

articles.title: Good news - humans are getting better at spotting malware but we're still pretty bad ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Humans don't do a bad job at spotting malware, especially with the right tools, but that's only if they're looking for it.    i.e. they're not looking for the malware. They are looking for a way to avoid it.

articles.title: GSSM Robotics Team Wins AI Award at Carolinas Premier Event
articles.author: submitted news
articles.summary: The South Carolina Governor's School for Science & Mathematics' all-girls robotics team, the Lobotomists, earned the AI Award at the Carolinas Premier Event, held July 25-27 at Salem Academy in Winston-Salem, N.C. The team used artificial intelligence to advance their team's goals and in designing, building and programming their robot.

articles.title: Making Edge AI Useful for Manufacturing
articles.author: Ghazanfar Ghori
articles.summary: Edge AI is a computer program that processes data at the edge, rather than relying on distant servers or the cloud. It can be used in manufacturing to prevent defects, identify safety hazards and adjust machine performance in real time. Ford used it for real-time, on-site vehicle inspections at its plants.

articles.title: Library workshop to offer training in AI use
articles.summary: Residents interested in artificial intelligence can explore the fundamentals of the technology during an upcoming workshop at the Georgia T. Lord Library in Goodyear. The workshop will take place on Tuesday, August 12, from 6 to 7:30 p.m. in the library's Community Room. It is free and open to the public.

articles.title: Experts Say AI ‘Can't Touch' These 10 Essential Idaho Jobs
articles.author: Mateo
articles.summary: According to a study done by Microsoft, some jobs that AI can only minimally impact, such as embalming, are more of a threat to some people's careers than others. Gallup study shows that white collar work is being most impacted by AI, even if people with those jobs are using or relying on AI more and more.
